FuncDef:
The explicit-path command configures an explicit path for a tunnel and displays the explicit path view.
The undo explicit-path command deletes an explicit path.
By default, no explicit path is created for the tunnel.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a unique name for an explicit path.
The value is a string of 1 to 128 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
An explicit path is used in either of the following situations during traffic planning:
A tunnel connecting links with light loads is established, preventing network congestion.A tunnel using available nodes that are not prone to attacks is established, improving tunnel security.

Prerequisites
MPLS TE has been enabled globally in the MPLS view.
Precautions
Nodes on an explicit path must have different IP addresses.
If an explicit path is in use, do not run the undo explicit-path command to delete the explicit path.
